details:
It was discovered that there was an off-by-one array size issue in
libtasn1-6, a library to manage the generic ASN.1 data structure.


* [CVE-2021-46848](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-46848)
GNU Libtasn1 before 4.19.0 has an ETYPE\_OK off-by-one array size check that affects asn1\_encode\_simple\_der.


For Debian 10 Buster, this problem has been fixed in version
4.13-3+deb10u1.


We recommend that you upgrade your libtasn1-6 packages.


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
